event.title: was claimed by Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo for Spain in 1542

data.event: Historically home to the Chumash and Tongva, Los Angeles was claimed by Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo for Spain in 1542 along with the rest of what would become Alta California.
The city was officially founded on September 4, 1781, by Spanish governor Felipe de Neve.

event.title: became a part of Mexico in 1821

data.event: It became a part of Mexico in 1821 following the Mexican War of Independence.

event.title: 1848, at the end of the Mexican–American War, Los Angeles and the rest of California were purchased

data.event: In 1848, at the end of the Mexican–American War, Los Angeles and the rest of California were purchased as part of the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, thereby becoming part of the United States.

event.title: was incorporated as a municipality on April 4, 1850

data.event: Los Angeles was incorporated as a municipality on April 4, 1850, five months before California achieved statehood.
Los Angeles was incorporated as a municipality on April 4, 1850, five months before California achieved statehood.
